intro: Daucus halophilus, commonly known as the saltbush carrot, is a flowering plant native to arid and saline environments. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers and feathery leaves that help reduce water loss. It thrives in coastal and saline soils, making it an important species for ecological restoration in harsh environments. Its ability to tolerate high salinity makes it a valuable subject for research in plant adaptation and agriculture.
